ratings.comment: This man still holds the record for the only professor who's lectures I enjoyed. Paul Kelly is amazing, energetic, and clearly cares about philosophy. Barely any homework, easy papers as midterm/final, and readings aren't mandatory since he talks about them in class anyway. Super easy and super entertaining/interesting, I highly recommend PHILOS101
Professor Kelly is a really great lecturer. He's really good at explaining and keeping his students engaged overall. I would highly recommend taking his classes because he is very friendly!

This is for PHILOS 243: Professor Kelly is one of the best professors I've had. His lectures encourage discussion, and he is willing to explain concepts over and over until you understand the material. He has weekly readings but they average only 3-7 pages. I would definitely take from him again!
I always looked forward to going to his lectures. One of the best professors I have ever had.
I love him he is the BEST

Hands down my favorite professor. He is extremely knowledgeable, explains the basics of philosophy in clear, bite size pieces, and just really expands your worldview in interesting ways. Pre-lecture readings are kinda optional, no other hw. Would absolutely recommend this prof to anyone looking for a easy, interesting humanities credit

pretty easy class and really interesting. we had a sub for like 2 weeks and couldnt wait until he came back. prof gave out exam questions before exam (def had to study) and the same questions were on the exam.

Had him for a course that was initially in person that moved to an online format later because of the pandemic. He was great in both modes of teaching and adjusted well. He's a super nice guy and is always willing to help, responding quickly anytime you have a question or would like to meet with him. Fun class, great teacher.
